autocom3.title: Autocom3 Website Revitalization
autocom3.description: Complete revitalization of the Autocom3 website, rebuilt part by part to make it as modern and unique as possible.
autocom3.detailedDescription: This project was developed with the aim of transforming the Autocom3 website, originally hosted on WordPress and built with Elementor, into a visually refined and technically customized platform. The central proposal was to break away from the generic patterns of sites made with low-code tools, reclaiming the essence of traditional front-end development. To achieve this, the entire layout was manually restructured with pure HTML and CSS, without the use of frameworks, valuing performance, originality, and total control over the code.

autoPonto.title: Auto Ponto
autoPonto.description: Electronic time tracking application developed for Autocom3.
autoPonto.detailedDescription: This project was developed to solve recurring challenges faced by Autocom3 in daily time tracking and hour bank management. The difficulties arose mainly from the dependence on third-party applications, which did not offer the necessary flexibility or reliability. Given this, I proposed and developed a proprietary application, fully designed to meet the specific needs of the company, ensuring greater accuracy in records, ease of adjustments, and total autonomy over the system's data and functionalities.

react.description: React is my primary frontend library. I use it to build interactive user interfaces with a component-based approach, focusing on reusability and maintainability.

tailwind.description: Tailwind CSS is my preferred styling solution for its utility-first approach that allows for rapid UI development with consistent design.

nodejs.description: Node.js is my runtime environment for server-side JavaScript, enabling me to build scalable network applications.

csharp.description: C# is my language of choice for backend development with .NET, particularly for enterprise applications and services.

python.description: I use Python for automation, data analysis, and backend development when simplicity and readability are priorities.

appwrite.description: Appwrite is my go-to backend-as-a-service platform for rapid development of web and mobile applications.

sql.description: SQL is essential for my database work, allowing me to query, manipulate, and manage relational databases effectively.

mongodb.description: MongoDB is my preferred NoSQL database for applications that require flexible schema design and horizontal scaling.

postgresql.description: PostgreSQL is my choice for advanced relational database needs, offering robust features and excellent performance.

git.description: Git is fundamental to my workflow for version control, collaboration, and code management.

docker.description: I use Docker to containerize applications, ensuring consistent environments across development and production.

vscode.description: Visual Studio Code is my primary code editor, enhanced with extensions for productivity and code quality.

vite.description: I use Vite as a build tool for rapid development, leveraging its fast compilation speed and hot module replacement for a more efficient development experience.

threejs.description: I work with Three.js to create interactive 3D graphics on the web, using WebGL for high-performance rendering and immersive visual experiences.

shadcn.description: I implement Shadcn/UI to create elegant and accessible interfaces, leveraging its Tailwind CSS-styled components for rapid and consistent development.

framermotion.description: I use Framer Motion to create declarative animations with a high level of control, enhancing user experience with fluid transitions and dynamic interactions.

blazor.description: I develop interactive web applications with Blazor, using C# and .NET to create rich user interfaces that run directly in the browser via WebAssembly.

supabase.description: I use Supabase as a backend-as-a-service to create APIs, manage authentication, and store data, leveraging its PostgreSQL database and real-time functionality.

express.description: I develop RESTful APIs with Express.js, a minimalist framework for Node.js that facilitates the creation of web servers and robust backend applications.

prisma.description: I use Prisma ORM to interact with databases in Node.js applications, leveraging its strong type system with TypeScript and automated migrations.

jwt.description: I implement authentication and authorization in web applications using JSON Web Tokens (JWT), ensuring security and scalability in RESTful APIs.

socketio.description: I develop real-time communication with Socket.IO, enabling bidirectional connections between clients and servers for applications like chats, live dashboards, and games.

postman.description: I use Postman to test, document, and automate APIs, facilitating development and ensuring the quality of programming interfaces.

vercel.description: I use the Vercel platform for continuous deployment and hosting of frontend applications, leveraging its Git integration and automatic optimizations.

eslint.description: I maintain code quality and consistency with ESLint and Prettier, establishing style standards and detecting potential problems before execution.
